bug_analysis.root_cause: Inconsistent return value behavior in JSON retrieval method

details.description: JSON.GET method returns an array with a single value when retrieving a single field, which is considered unintuitive by the user
details.expected_behavior: Return the direct value instead of a single-element array
details.current_behavior: Returns [value] instead of value when getting a single JSON field
details.impact: Requires additional client-side processing to extract single values
details.reproducibility: Consistent across JSON.GET operations with single field selection

bug_analysis.recommendation: Modify JSON.GET to return scalar values directly when a single field is requested

title: [BUG] json.get default behavior is dumb and unintuitive

bug_analysis.root_cause: WATCH command does not properly handle key expiration, failing to trigger transaction failure when a watched key expires

details.description: The WATCH command in Redis transactions does not consider expired keys as a trigger for transaction failure, which contradicts expected transactional behavior
details.expected_behavior: Transaction should fail if a watched key expires or is deleted
details.actual_behavior: Transaction continues even if watched key expires
details.community_consensus: Recognized as a potential bug by core Redis developers

title: [BUG] WATCH ignores keys which has expired

bug_analysis.Root Cause: Inconsistent documentation describing maximum string value size between different pages

Details.Reason for 512 MB: To ensure whole space is addressable as a bitmap using 32-bit unsigned integer

Resolution.Action: Documentation to be updated for consistency

title: Binary string as value max size

bug_analysis.Root Cause: Inconsistent COUNT behavior for different set encodings (intset vs regular set)

Details.Description: SSCAN COUNT parameter does not consistently limit returned elements across different set encodings

Behavior.Integer Set (intset): Returns all elements regardless of COUNT

Details.Technical Explanation: For small sets encoded as intsets, Redis returns all elements in first SCAN call, ignoring COUNT parameter
Details.Confirmed By: Redis maintainer @oranagra, who clarified COUNT is an advisory parameter, not a strict limit

bug_analysis.Recommended Action: Document the behavior clearly, consider potential future improvements to scan cursor mechanism

title: [BUG] redis version 6.2.3 sscan count is not work for int number

bug_analysis.Root Cause: Terminology confusion in Redis mode reporting - 'standalone' does not mean single instance, but non-clustered mode

Details.Observed Behavior: Redis-cli reports 'redis_mode:standalone' even in Sentinel configuration
Details.Expected Behavior: Consistent mode reporting across Redis and Sentinel CLIs
Details.Impact: Cosmetic/reporting issue, no functional impact on Redis operation

Resolution.Official Response: Not a bug, but potentially confusing terminology
Resolution.Explanation: In Redis, 'standalone' refers to non-clustered mode and can include master-replica setups

title: [BUG] Redis-cli INFO says its running in standalone mode even though it is running with Sentinel (6.0.10)
